pages.text:
Events Calendar
Immersive Space Symphony
Back by popular demand after
seven weeks of sold-out performances
,
Immersive Space Symphony
returns for its second year with an
all-new experience
. Prepare to be transported to the outer reaches of the galaxy in this 360-degree symphony experience. A full orchestra performs
Hans Zimmer’s most iconic compositions
, while projection mapping transforms every surface around you into an ever-changing work of art.
This year’s edition takes audiences on a breathtaking multisensory journey through the iconic music of legendary composer
Hans Zimmer
. Featuring unforgettable scores from blockbuster films like
Interstellar
,
Inception
, and
Dune
, this reimagined performance blends classical music, immersive visuals, and cutting-edge technology to transport you across galaxies and into the heart of Zimmer’s cinematic worlds.
Tickets are now on sale!
Program:
Man of Steel - Zimmer
Apollo 13 - Horner
Oppenheimer Suite - Göransson
Can You Hear the Music - Göransson
Mars - Holst
Jupiter - Holst
Inception Suite - Zimmer
Dune Suite  - Zimmer
Interstellar Suite - Zimmer
WARNING: This show contains moving projections and strobe lighting, which may affect some individuals.
PERFORMANCES
August 30 | 5 PM & 7 PM
September 6 | 5 PM & 7 PM
September 13 | 5 PM & 7 PM
September 20 | 5 PM & 7 PM
LOCATION
Emanuel Luxury Venue
1723 Washington Ave
Miami Beach, FL 33139
Buy Tickets
Our Sponsors
With the support of the Miami Beach Visitor and Convention Authority and the City of Miami Beach.
The Miami Beach Classical Music Festival is funded by the Department of State, City of Miami Beach, Division of Cultural Affairs, National Endowment for the Arts and The Children’s Trust to promote artistic excellence, creativity, and innovation in our communities. The Children’s Trust is a dedicated source of revenue established by voter referendum to improve the lives of children and families in Miami-Dade County.

The mission of the Miami Beach Classical Music Festival is to provide affordable, world-class musical instruction and ground-breaking performance experiences to young artists and the South Florida region.
Since its 2013 inception, Miami Beach Classical Music Festival (MMF) has been proud to establish Miami as a premier destination for elite young classical musicians to train and perform. While the next generation of classical artists come to Miami to receive instruction from an assembly of world-class faculty, the community benefits from accessible public concerts featuring top talent alongside many of classical music’s greatest living performers in repertoire rarely heard in South Florida.
With training institutes in Orchestra, Opera, Piano, and Conducting, MMF development also includes an Alumni Division, Pre-College Program, a pioneering Career Institute, and the Professional Miami Wagner Institute to support artists in all stages of their careers. MMF receives nearly 1,500 international applicants each season, selecting around 200 participants through a rigorous audition process. MMF has welcomed students and faculty from over 25 countries and many of the world’s most esteemed music institutions. The festival attracts internationally sought-after performers and teaching-artists eager to identify and cultivate the pre-professional careers of talented young musicians.
In eleven seasons, the festival has expanded to present over 70 public events each year, including 5 full opera productions, 4 symphonic concerts, 7 student and faculty recitals; 20 opera, chamber music, Zarzuela, and Musical theater concerts; and 30 masterclasses hosted throughout Miami venues. Furthermore, MMF is dedicated to engaging local youth and Miami’s underserved neighborhoods through successful outreach, community partnerships and by providing accessible events and tickets.
After unprecedented growth in its eleven years, MMF continues to build on its success by expanding programming, increasing community outreach, and creating unique classical opportunities that bring pride to our vibrant and cultured city.
A MESSAGE FROM MICHAEL ROSSI, FOUNDER AND ARTISTIC DIRECTOR
Dear Esteemed Patrons,
We are honored to have you join us for the eleventh season of the Miami Beach Classical Music Festival (MMF). Our 2024 season brought more than 200 young artists to Miami Beach for six weeks of study and performance experiences.
MMF is grateful to return to our home on Miami Beach since 2019. MMF deepens its partnership with The Betsy-South Beach, its longtime host hotel, and will continue as a special concert venue for evening student performances, as it has done since the program’s inception. Temple Emanu-El will also be hosting a Symphony Concert for our MMF Conducting Institute where emerging artists gain valuable experience leading a full orchestra while being coached, as they study all aspects of the art of conducting with acclaimed faculty.
I can’t express how grateful we are to the City of Miami Beach, The Betsy-South Beach, and Faena Art for giving us so much support to make this festival possible. We’ve experienced unprecedented growth each season thanks to the cooperation and encouragement we’ve received city-wide. It gives us great pleasure to give back to our Miami communities through our work and performances.
Sincerely,
Michael Rossi
MMF Artistic Director & Founder

With the support of the Miami Beach Visitor and Convention Authority (VCA) and the City of Miami Beach.
The Miami Beach Classical Music Festival is funded by the Department of State, City of Miami Beach, Division of Cultural Affairs, National Endowment for the Arts and The Children’s Trust to promote artistic excellence, creativity, and innovation in our communities. The Children’s Trust is a dedicated source of revenue established by voter referendum to improve the lives of children and families in Miami-Dade County.

With the support of the Miami Beach Visitor and Convention Authority (VCA) and the City of Miami Beach.
The Miami Beach Classical Music Festival is funded by the Department of State, City of Miami Beach, Division of Cultural Affairs, National Endowment for the Arts and The Children’s Trust to promote artistic excellence, creativity, and innovation in our communities. The Children’s Trust is a dedicated source of revenue established by voter referendum to improve the lives of children and families in Miami-Dade County.
The mission of the Miami Beach Classical Music Festival is to provide affordable, world-class musical instruction and ground-breaking performance experiences to young artists and the South Florida region.
Since its 2013 inception, Miami Beach Classical Music Festival (MMF) has been proud to establish Miami as a premier destination for elite young classical musicians to train and perform. While the next generation of classical artists come to Miami to receive instruction from an assembly of world-class faculty, the community benefits from accessible public concerts featuring top talent alongside many of classical music’s greatest living performers in repertoire rarely heard in South Florida.
With training institutes in Orchestra, Opera, Piano, and Conducting, MMF development also includes an Alumni Division, Pre-College Program, a pioneering Career Institute, and the Professional Miami Wagner Institute to support artists in all stages of their careers. MMF receives nearly 1,500 international applicants each season, selecting around 200 participants through a rigorous audition process. MMF has welcomed students and faculty from over 25 countries and many of the world’s most esteemed music institutions. The festival attracts internationally sought-after performers and teaching-artists eager to identify and cultivate the pre-professional careers of talented young musicians.
In eleven seasons, the festival has expanded to present over 70 public events each year, including 5 full opera productions, 4 symphonic concerts, 7 student and faculty recitals; 20 opera, chamber music, Zarzuela, and Musical theater concerts; and 30 masterclasses hosted throughout Miami venues. Furthermore, MMF is dedicated to engaging local youth and Miami’s underserved neighborhoods through successful outreach, community partnerships and by providing accessible events and tickets.
After unprecedented growth in its eleven years, MMF continues to build on its success by expanding programming, increasing community outreach, and creating unique classical opportunities that bring pride to our vibrant and cultured city.
A MESSAGE FROM MICHAEL ROSSI, FOUNDER AND ARTISTIC DIRECTOR
Dear Esteemed Patrons,
We are honored to have you join us for the eleventh season of the Miami Beach Classical Music Festival (MMF). Our 2024 season brought more than 200 young artists to Miami Beach for six weeks of study and performance experiences.
MMF is grateful to return to our home on Miami Beach since 2019. MMF deepens its partnership with The Betsy-South Beach, its longtime host hotel, and will continue as a special concert venue for evening student performances, as it has done since the program’s inception. Temple Emanu-El will also be hosting a Symphony Concert for our MMF Conducting Institute where emerging artists gain valuable experience leading a full orchestra while being coached, as they study all aspects of the art of conducting with acclaimed faculty.
I can’t express how grateful we are to the City of Miami Beach, The Betsy-South Beach, and Faena Art for giving us so much support to make this festival possible. We’ve experienced unprecedented growth each season thanks to the cooperation and encouragement we’ve received city-wide. It gives us great pleasure to give back to our Miami communities through our work and performances.
Sincerely,
Michael Rossi
MMF Artistic Director & Founder

Events Calendar
Immersive Space Symphony
Back by popular demand after
seven weeks of sold-out performances
,
Immersive Space Symphony
returns for its second year with an
all-new experience
. Prepare to be transported to the outer reaches of the galaxy in this 360-degree symphony experience. A full orchestra performs
Hans Zimmer’s most iconic compositions
, while projection mapping transforms every surface around you into an ever-changing work of art.
This year’s edition takes audiences on a breathtaking multisensory journey through the iconic music of legendary composer
Hans Zimmer
. Featuring unforgettable scores from blockbuster films like
Interstellar
,
Inception
, and
Dune
, this reimagined performance blends classical music, immersive visuals, and cutting-edge technology to transport you across galaxies and into the heart of Zimmer’s cinematic worlds.
Tickets are now on sale!
Program:
Man of Steel - Zimmer
Apollo 13 - Horner
Oppenheimer Suite - Göransson
Can You Hear the Music - Göransson
Mars - Holst
Jupiter - Holst
Inception Suite - Zimmer
Dune Suite  - Zimmer
Interstellar Suite - Zimmer
WARNING: This show contains moving projections and strobe lighting, which may affect some individuals.
PERFORMANCES
August 30 | 5 PM & 7 PM
September 6 | 5 PM & 7 PM
September 13 | 5 PM & 7 PM
September 20 | 5 PM & 7 PM
LOCATION
Emanuel Luxury Venue
1723 Washington Ave
Miami Beach, FL 33139
